item.title: Retweeting Twitter Mentions On Demand with Twilio SMS and ASP.NET Core
item.description: Programming tutorial demonstrating how to retweet Twitter mentions on demand from SMS messages sent through Twilio Programmable SMS and the Twitter API using an ASP.NET Core app running on an Azure app service.
item.author: (By David Pine 2020-03-19)

item.title: 5 Reasons Why You As a Developer Should Venture Into Machine Learning Today
item.description: I’m fortunate enough to occasionally be invited to speak at conferences around the world about what I’m truly passionate about. Having the opportunity to teach machine learning to groups of highly skilled .NET developers is a privilege and one of the most rewarding things I get to do. I often get questions from developers why they should invest time into learning a completely new domain, and why companies shouldn’t just hire “real” Data Scientists. I wanted to take a moment to write down why I think developers in the .NET community should take an interest, a leap of faith if you will, and venture in the world of machine learning.
item.author: (Alexander Slotte)

item.title: Acheve.Authentication.Events 3.1.3
item.description: Achve.Authentication.Events is a nuget package that implements authentication events with detailed log information and description about the event. It´s implemented to be used in learning and debug worflows related to the authentication proccess in Asp.Net Core For more information see https://github.com/hbiarge/Acheve.Authentication.Events

item.title: Microsoft Edge Is The Least Private Browser, Study Finds
item.description: The study examined the unique identifiers, as well as information related to typed URLs which can be used to track down users. Microsoft Edge sent identifiers tied to the device hardware. The unique identifiers, which can be used to link apps on the device, remained the same despite re-installing the browser.
item.author: (Charanjeet Singh)

item.title: Announcing F# 5 preview 1 | .NET Blog
item.description: We’re excited to announce that F# 5 preview 1 is now available! Here’s how to get it: Install .NET 5 preview SDK Install Jupyter Notebooks for .NET If you’re using Visual Studio on Windows, you’ll need both the .NET 5 preview SDK and Visual Studio Preview installed.
item.author: (Phillip CarterProgram Manager, .NET and LanguagesFollow)

item.title: Lazily resolving services to fix circular dependencies in .NET Core - Thomas Levesque's .NET blog
item.description: The problem with circular dependencies When building an application, good design dictates that you should avoid circular dependencies between your services. A circular dependency is when some components depend on each other, directly or indirectly, e.g. A depends on B which depends on C which depends on A: It is generally agreed that this should … Continue reading Lazily resolving services to fix circular dependencies in .NET Core →

item.title: Avoid In-Memory Databases for Tests

item.title: AdoptOpenJDK
item.description: AdoptOpenJDK provides prebuilt OpenJDK binaries from a fully open source set of build scripts and infrastructure. Supported platforms include Linux, macOS, Windows, ARM, Solaris, and AIX.
